abstract.p: BravoMed, part of Bravo Group, unit of Young & Rubicam, opens agency in New York; Graphica.eCRM Corp is opened by Grafica Inc; Creativworks is opening franchised office in Indianapolis; iToymaker.com, new-media agency specializing in online youth entertainment market, opens in Los Angeles (S)

block.p: Several agencies have opened for business.

BravoMed in New York, part of the Bravo Group, a unit of Young & Rubicam, will specialize in pharmaceutical marketing aimed at Spanish-speaking consumers. The agency has 16 employees working for clients like Whitehall Robins, part of American Home Products. Meg Bernot-Rodriguez, senior vice president and managing partner at Bravo, will also hold the same titles at BravoMed. Young & Rubicam is now part of the WPP Group.
Several agencies have opened for business.

BravoMed in New York, part of the Bravo Group, a unit of Young & Rubicam, will specialize in pharmaceutical marketing aimed at Spanish-speaking consumers. The agency has 16 employees working for clients like Whitehall Robins, part of American Home Products. Meg Bernot-Rodriguez, senior vice president and managing partner at Bravo, will also hold the same titles at BravoMed. Young & Rubicam is now part of the WPP Group.

The Graphica.eCRM Corporation, a marketing company in Chester, N.J., with clients like AT&T and the New Jersey lottery, was opened by Grafica Inc. Graphica.eCRM has eight employees and is headed by Debra A. Taeschler, 47, who continues as president at Grafica.

Creativworks in St. Louis, which specializes in working for small to midsize businesses, is opening a franchised office in Indianapolis. The agency has 20 employees and is headed by Keith Alper, 38, as chief executive; he had been chief executive at the Creative Producers Group in St. Louis.

And IToymaker.com, a new-media agency specializing in the online youth entertainment market, opened in Los Angeles with 10 employees working for clients like Britney Brands. Jacqueline Hein, 36, was named chief executive; she had been president of Hein Financial Services in Los Angeles.

THE MEDIA BUSINESS: ADVERTISING -- ADDENDA Correction: October 5, 2000, Thursday An entry in the Addenda listing on the Media Business page on Tuesday about the opening of an office in Indianapolis by Creativworks, an advertising agency in St. Louis, misidentified the head of the office. He is Bill Olson; Keith Alper is chief executive of the company.
